description: Borrowed from Italian cantabile (“singable, capable being sung”), derived from cantare (“to sing”). See also Latin cantabilis (“worthy to be sung”).

adjectives.description: cantabile (comparative more cantabile, superlative most cantabile)

entries.meaning: (music) Describing a passage having this mark; singable, lyrical

adverbs.description: cantabile (comparative more cantabile, superlative most cantabile)

entries.meaning: (music) Played in this style; singingly, lyrically
(music) A tempo mark directing that a passage is to be played in a lyrical manner
